lines.text: You okay?
Eh, so-so. You know, except for this
[holds up his bandaged hand]
They cut your finger off? You fuckin' sick fucks. It's all this fuckin' rap shit, isn't it?
Don't even mention the fuckin' boots to me again. You got that?
Sorry Lono.
It's not fuckin' funny.
I know! I'm kidding!
I don't wanna hear about any fuckin' kinda footwear from you again. Don't even talk about fuckin' socks to me.

Well, if you give me a couple minutes of your time, I got a few things I'd like to talk to ya about. You know, uh, what you did wasn't really your fault. It's what you call a, uh, genetic defect. Mom called it the, the gene. My grandfather had the gene. He, uh, came over on the boat from Ireland in 1912 and I guess he passed it on to my old man. My old man was a great guy, a real pussy cat, you know, hard worker. Big sports fan, but sometimes on his way home from the docks he liked to stop in with the guys and have a couple of beers, ya know. I remember coming home from school one day, and, uh, the whole house was dark. Couldn't figure it out. I heard my mom crying off in the dark someplace, and I was old enough at that point I could reach the light switch. I turned the lights on, and I saw what he did to her. So I went to my room and I got the, uh, baseball bat. Mickey Mantel model my old man give me for Christmas, and I found the old man passed out in the bathtub, and I tattooed him. Needless to say, when I came home every day from school after that, the, uh, house is lit up like Ebbets Field, and the old man, uh, never drank again. So all I'm saying to you is, if you wanna drink, you go ahead and drink. But if I ever find out that you laid your hands on that little girl again, me and Mr. Mantle are gonna pay you a visit, my friend.
The gun again. Can't you guys just play nice?
Drop the gun, asshole.

[finally fed up]
Why don't you drop your gun?
I don't drop my fucking gun, okay?

[in a mocking voice]
Okay.

Listen, Charlie. Whatever condition Elise is returned home in is the exact same condition you will be returned to your home. If she loses an eye, you lose an eye. If she loses an ear, you get to lose an ear. If she gets hurt, you will be hurt. Listen to me, by saving Lisa you get to save yourself.
cops lie, newspapers lie, parents lie. The one thing you can count on - word on the street... yeah, that's solid.
get out of this. Now. Before it gets so fucked up nobody could ever recover.
Why is this man here? Why is he taped to my father's favorite chair?

[after hitting Jennifer's father with her toaster]
Sorry about the toaster.
Guys, if I don't bleed to death pretty soon, I'm gonna die of boredom.
[They let Charlie go]

What the fuck? I leave the room for two minutes and you guys roll over like 5 dollar whores! You have a drink with the guy and next thing you know he's best man at your wedding! What the fuck did he do when I was in the other room, sprinkle fairy dust up your skirts?
I want you and your weird fuck junkie friend out of my house.
Well, I'm wondering, how come a day and a half ago Max can't navigate his way around Harlem with a Sherpa guide, but tonight he knows the place like his backyard?
A busket?
You guys didn't think this through too good, did you?
Oh, she's more than beautiful. She's got this way she looks at you, just... just stop your heart, you know? And make it start back up again. You know any girls like that?
Yeah. All of them.
I'm bleeding to death. Humor me.
Don't go dying on me. Remember, I'm a lawyer. I've got friends in hell.
[Repeated line]
You cut his fucking finger off!
I think I'm done on this side.
[after "correcting" a story about him told by Brett]
Everything your pal Brett said is true. Except he left out one detail. Those dogs... that was not steak they were eating.
Anybody wants to hold hands with my dick, I insist they buy me a drink first. I mean, after all, I'm not asking for dinner and dancing.

[as Brett picks up the phone to dial]
It will show up on my old man's bill.
Ira, you're unbelievable. What do you want, a fucking quarter?
He will know we were here!

[smashes vase]
Well, you know what, now he's gonna know we were here anyway!
It's an aniversary present!
Good, fag. Pick it up.
Ira, come here. You are the man. Remember that. Okay.
That's fresh ice. That's very cold!

[to Avery]
Thank your lucky stars I don't let Lono do to you what he wants to.
Fuckin A right.
The gun again. Can't you guys just play nice?
I can't let you go.
Avery, we don't have a choice.
I gotta gun in my hand! We have a choice!
You're pretty funny for a guy with nine fingers.
Hey-hey, big time, how ya doin?
Good.
Listen, ahh, there's been a new wrinkle.
What?
But first you gotta promise me, PROMISE ME, you're not going to tell anybody.
Ira, what are you talking about?
Look, just promise me first.
Fuck off, Ira.
Okay, good enough.
That's just bad business.
Very bad. Fuckin' tragic.
Wait, wait... BOAT? What BOAT?
You should never lie to your friends.
A number of times, the only thing that kept me out of a satin box was I could size up the other guy maybe half a second quicker than he could me.

[laughing]
What the fuck are you talking about? You're taped to a chair! He saw us coming a mile away at the Plaza! Didn't you?

[laughing]
I admit I'm out of practice.

[fed up about the boot issue]
That's it, I'm letting out! This is worse than having my fucking mother in the car!

[Lono holds everyone at gun point, T.K.'s beeper goes off]
It's my girlfriend.
T.K., call your woman back, come on...
He had nothing to do with Elise's kidnapping, he had nothing to do with it. Can't you understand that? He didnt do anything!
It doesn't matter! They're all alike! Whoever did the actual kidnapping... It's a fucking technicality!
You're good. Look that up in the Constitution.
Max, shut up.

[while emptying a vase]
Hasn't anyone here ever heard of a bedpan?

[shaking his head]
T.K., no. It's from Sri Lanka.

[handing Ira the flowers that were in the vase]
These are for you.
That's not funny, T.K.!

[as they argue over who will help Charlie take a piss]
All right. Since I'm in charge, fuck it, Max, you do it.
Fuck that, I'm not doing it. Avery, you can do it.
No, I'm not doing it.
Guys, It's my dick, I pick.
Well, life don't make sense. It's not fair. It doesn't follow logic or obey orders.
[after it is revealed that both Avery and Max were involved in Elise's kidnapping]
Charlie, what do you want me to do?
Shoot...
No!

[points]
... him.
[Lono shoots Brett in the leg. Brett goes down, screaming]
Aw, fuck, why *me*?

his own kidnapping]
It was *your* idea, Dunsky!
